instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD Replacement???
threads.message: We had customer bring in a 2013 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with cracked LCD.  We replaced the LCD and there is no backlight/image.  We tried 2 different LCDs and neither worked.  We reinstall the old LCD and backlight and scrambled image is there.  Has anyone seen anything like this before??? I know there is a difference between 2015 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD and 2012-2014 LCDs.  But is there different models for the 2012-2014?? We have replaced these before and never experienced this issue??

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD Replacement???
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> LCD Replacement???
threads.message: 2 of the LP154WT1-SJAV was installed and not working. LP154WT1 SJE1 was model of broken one that came out of laptop. I was under the impression the "SJAV" model was compatible with all 2012-2014 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>????
